turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You're acting like a crazy person.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You're straddling the state line. You're in two places at once.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's places like this that make me certain there's a God.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: What do you actually know with religion?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The Challenger exploded. Principal Kelly's about to make an announcement.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: How do you know this place?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Before the divorce. My father used to take me here. Fire spotting was his summer job.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: From here he proved to me the earth isn't flat.  On rainy days, we'd be above the clouds.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: What would you do up here?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The truth. I just left you out of it.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's an alt-azimuth design with one parabolic mirror and one secondary flat one.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: In my back yard.  I lied before. It's hardly started. But when it's done, it will have twice the power of this one --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: So what do you want to see?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: A Thermos of hot coffee. A blanket. Socks.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Are you trying to seduce me?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'm always home by midnight and he's always asleep.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: What's the best thing I can see tonight?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Here. Why am I looking at this star?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Because I had it named for you. I know it's not an official designation --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: From citizen high to citizen low.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Care, but just don't let it get to you. It gives them power.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Yes. I try to keep my power.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You're worried about your college applications.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You're going to take a year off? Join the Peace Corps -- ?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Then I'll take you home. You'll feel better tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: The doctors said to do everything the same as long as possible.  I didn't want anyone being -- weird around me.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm so sorry. I'm a coward --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I should have told you sooner --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I made you do too many things, kept you up all night --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No. The drugs just stopped working. If anything, doing things I love kept me healthy longer.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: All the time.  I feel like I have no one.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Help me live until I die?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Slim Jim? Apple? Yogurt? You like yogurt.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: That I want you to take me home.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I don't want to come here anymore.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Whatever you need. Whatever Jamie needs. I'm here.  I could start by driving her to school --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'm not going back to school.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I was going to fake it.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: 'What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.' Aristotle.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: 'Find out who you are and do it on purpose.' Dolly Parton.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: 'Love is always patient and kind. It is never boastful or conceited -- '

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: That was read at my parents' wedding.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Because you have hope that you'll get better?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No.  Maybe I believe God has a bigger dream for me than I had for myself.  Maybe I believe the journey, the big adventure, never ends...

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's not that simple.  It costs money to do this at home.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You'll be fine for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Will you do something for me?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Landon. I can't even do for myself.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: But if you could, you would?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: The Carter boy. Tell me about him.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: He wants help with his lines --

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Jamie, he's careless. Reckless.  Is this really the best time to be making a new friend...?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I'm supposed to always be alone?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I don't want you to see him outside school activities.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Fine. But I need to start deciding how to spend my time and my life.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I'm sorry your mother isn't here to help you become a woman.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Dad, I've become a woman without her. Just not a pretty one.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I thought we had rid ourselves of his disagreeable companionship.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Did you give him a gift?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I saw the way he looked at you. The way he kissed you.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: It's time to tell him.  It would be the right thing.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Maybe. But that's not the real reason. You think if I tell, he'll disappear and that's what you want! Me all to yourself!

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: No. I want what's best for you.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: This -- him -- Landon -- is what's best for me!

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No you didn't.  But he did change. Just not enough.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Jamie, you're not mad at me. You're mad at Landon --

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: I am mad at you! And at Landon! And the universe! And God!  I don't even know where to put all my anger.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: That's normal. God accepts your anger. He won't punish you.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: By making me ill, he is punishing me!  I just don't know what for.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: When Mom died you told me God wanted her more, loved her more --

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I was wrong. Nobody could have wanted or loved your mother more than we did. Not even God.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Apropos of nothing... so. So so so so --

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Let's get something straight. You don't know me. I don't know you. But I know what you're about.  Keep your distance from this house -- and from Jamie.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Reverend Sullivan. Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Does it have to do with Jamie?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'd like to take Jamie to dinner on New Year's Eve.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I don't want to see her hurt.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Landon. You're not the quiet type.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: So talk to us about something.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Okay. Sure.  My grandfather. When he was seven, he shook the hand of an old guy, a war vet or something, who had once shaken President Lincoln's hand.  Made a big impression on him.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: We didn't tell him any different for years --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Since I was five. My mom's a cocktail waitress.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: How do you -- the two of you -- get by?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: It's her decision and she's decided not to tell people -- at least for now.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: How -- how long does she have?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Her doctors have. Jamie and I. We're still praying for a miracle.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Landon. We've lived with this for over a year now and --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: If there is a God, how could he let this happen??!!

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I need to be with her.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I've almost finished the rocker. Did she order mirrors?

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: You have materials for the side bearings?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm using an old phonographic turntable.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: I helped Jamie with the first one.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I thought she built it herself.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: She did. But hardly anyone does anything truly alone.

turns.speaker: REV. SULLIVAN
turns.text: Jamie wanted that. She told me.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm sorry she never got her miracle.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Like you'd make it to June. Even cutting half your classes, you have a B- average.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: That's right. You just act like one.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Now I can do what I want.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: That's right.  The world is your oyster.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Finding the real world to your liking, Mr. Carter?

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: You could grace our hallowed halls again, if, while you're here, you make a sincere effort to be part of our little school community --

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: How would you do that, Mr. Carter?

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Shall I give you a few ideas?

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Besides attending all your regular classes, I'd like you to help our janitorial staff after school --

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: For the inner satisfaction it will bring.  Saturday mornings, I'd like you to tutor disadvantaged students at our sister school --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm as underprivileged as they are --

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Finally, I'd like you to join the drama club. Rehearsals are Tuesday and Thursday evenings.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Or something. They're doing a play for the holidays.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: When do I get time for me?

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Landon, none of us faculty see you the way you see yourself.  Some of us remember how your father --

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Then you remember more than I do.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: No way. No thanks. I can't do it --

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: -- You can and you will, Mr. Carter.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: It's mine to give. I didn't steal it.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: Your grades for fall semester. They're -- good.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You came here to give me my report card?

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: I've seen students with records like yours go to J.C. for a couple of years, then transfer to a good college.

turns.speaker: MR. KELLY
turns.text: I'd gladly write you a letter of recommendation.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Am I at the same angle to you and the basket as before?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: So what did we just make?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: What else? What kind of triangle has three sides of different lengths.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: Well, well, he smirked when Marty opened the door. If it isn't the neighborhood bootlegger, Al Capone McFly?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: Show me some respect, you little asshole. It's Special Officer Tannen to you.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: The day I show respect to Biff Tannen will be the day I win a million dollars... What's the matter, Biff, they're not showing you any respect down at the golf course? Don't they realize what a tough job it is keeping the criminal element away from the country club?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: Listen you little Asshole, I oughta --

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: This... is the number one single?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I don't get it. How come there's no rock 'n roll?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: And you never heard of rock 'n roll?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Gimme some chili, fries, and a Tab.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hot tip,  Rubber Biscuit in the third race at Arlington.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Dick, what's with those guys out there in the gutter?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Third time they've been out there this week.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I don't know. National Cash Register?

turns.speaker: EILEEN
turns.text: I've been calling you for five minutes! Didn't you hear me?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I was practicing. I've got an audition next week -- I gotta practice. How am I gonna get famous if I don't practice?

turns.speaker: EILEEN
turns.text: You mean you're going to stay up all night?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Mom, how else are we gonna see the sunrise?

turns.speaker: EILEEN
turns.text: I don't think I like the idea of you staying out all night with a girl!

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: How could I forget?  Oh, sure, I remember you.

turns.speaker: EILEEN
turns.text: Well, I was on my way to school, and I just wanted to stop by and see if you were feeling okay.  You seemed like you were in pretty bad shape the other night.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Oh, I'm feeling much better now.

turns.speaker: EILEEN
turns.text: Then you'll be going to school here....?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: School? I never thought of school! If I went to school I could blend in with everybody else, couldn't I?
